channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: ROBERT HARDMAN: The eagle has landed (again): It's a wonderful sight for those supporting Mail Force
item.description: ROBERT HARDMAN: Piled floor to ceiling in a giant Boeing 777, a vital new contribution to the war against the coronavirus arrived in Britain yesterday, courtesy of donors to Mail Force.

item.title: How will the coronavirus test and trace system work?
item.description: The much-delayed scheme was unveiled at yesterday's coronavirus press conference by Health Secretary Matt Hancock, who said it was the 'civic duty' of the public to adhere to the new rules.

item.title: Boeing to lay off more than 13,000 workers including 6,700 involuntary job cuts in US
item.description: Boeing announced Wednesday it will lay off around 13,000 workers including 6,770 involuntary cuts while 5,520 staffers were accepted for voluntary severance packages.

item.title: Donald Trump calls death of George Floyd 'a very sad event' and will be briefed on it on Thursday
item.description: President Donald Trump called the death of George Floyd, the Minnesota black man who died in custody when a white police officer kneeled on his neck, a 'very sad event.'

item.title: Not every recovered coronavirus patients develops enough 'neutralizing' antibodies
item.description: In a new study from Rockefeller University, 79% of 149 recovered coronavirus patients who donated plasma had low levels of antibodies in their blood but 1% of 'elite donors' had high levels.

item.title: US coronavirus death toll tops 100,000 just four months after the first case was confirmed
item.description: At least 100,047 Americans have so far died from coronavirus and there are currently over 1.6 million cases across the United States.

item.title: Larry Kramer, playwright and AIDS activist, dies at 84
item.description: Playwright and activist Larry Kramer, whose powerful writing triggered a response to the AIDS crisis and changed national health policy, has died at the age of 84 of pneumonia.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Pubs and restaurants 'could open next month'
item.description: Boris Johnson tonight told MPs he hopes to allow watering holes and restaurants to re-open earlier than July 4 - the date which has been set down in the government's roadmap out of lockdown.

item.title: Trump will sign executive order on 'social media' in wake of Twitter fact-checking his tweets
item.description: President Trump will sign some sort of 'social media'-focused executive order on Thursday, White House officials said, amid a rift with Twitter after the company started fact-checking his tweets.

item.title: Jeremy Corbyn is pictured 'flouting social distancing rules'
item.description: The snapshot, posted to Facebook, reportedly shows the former Labour leader standing close to passer-by Joe Neary on Tuesday as he made a trip to a lock.

item.title: NASA calls off SpaceX launch over lightning risk to astronauts
item.description: Launch America has been canceled due to on-and-off rain and a tornado warning hanging over Kennedy Space Center in Cape Canaveral, Florida - with just 16 minutes left on the clock before launch.

item.title: Emily Maitlis DID breach BBC's impartiality rules, admits broadcaster
item.description: Reporter Katie Razzall stood in for Emily Maitlis on tonight's Newsnight after the BBC admitted the host breached impartiality rules in an opening monologue about the Dominic Cummings row.

item.title: Screen legend Mae West to be profiled in new PBS documentary
item.description: 'Mae West: Dirty Blonde' will premiere on June 16 at 8 p.m. ET on PBS. The actress, singer, playwright, and screenwriter died at age 87 in 1980.

item.title: Prince Charles has got his wish for a slimmed-down monarchy, says his close friend Lady Glenconner
item.description: Lady Glenconner, former lady-in-waiting to Princess Margaret, was speaking in the wake of Prince Andrew stepping back from royal duties over the Epstein scandal and Prince Harry leaving the UK.

item.title: One-in-four UK firms warn of layoffs when furlough scheme is scaled back in August
item.description: Research by the Institute of Directors shows that firms are worried about being able to keep staff on if they are forced to contribute to 20 per cent of wage bills and National Insurance contributions.

item.title: Bill Clinton accused of affair with Ghislaine Maxwell in new book
item.description: The details of the alleged affair between the former president and the British socialite are detailed in a new book - A Convenient Death: The Mysterious Demise of Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: New video shows George Floyd being dragged out of his car
item.description: Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey called for prosecutors to arrest and charge the white police officer Derek Chauvin over his role in black man George Floyd's death on Monday.

item.title: Policemen fired for George Floyd arrest previously investigated
item.description: Derek Chauvin, 44, main, the officer filmed kneeling Floyd's, bottom inset, neck is a 19-year veteran of the force who was investigated over a fatal police shooting in 2006. Tou Thao is top inset.

item.title: HENRY DEEDES: Boris Johnson was like a tin of Pedigree Chum attacked by a schnauzer
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: Hair skew-whiff, a homely fireplace as backdrop and matey, first-name terms only. The Prime Minister appeared before the Liaison Committee yesterday.

item.title: Hogweed can grow up to 20ft tall and cause burns and blindness - now they're marching across Britain
item.description: Like something out of 'The Day Of The Triffids', giant hogweed can blind people and inflict other life-changing injuries, including excruciating blisters which need skin grafts.

item.title: Amazed father-of-one has a profanity-laden reaction when his wife reveals she is expecting TRIPLETS
item.description: Mother-of-one Samantha Grill from Waverly, Iowa, captured the humorous video of husband Jason after having to attend her pre-natal scan alone due to Covid-19 restrictions.

item.title: Mexican cartel leader fights extradition to US for 1985 murder
item.description: Rafael Caro Quintero is fighting an extradition to the U.S. for the 1985 kidnapping and murder of DEA agent Enrique Camarena. He told a Mexican court he has no money and is unemployed.

item.title: Coronavirus in sewage can predict outbreaks up to a WEEK before cases peak
item.description: Yale University scientists took daily measurements of coronavirus in sewage. Every sample contained virus, but levels peaked and declined days earlier than hospitalizations and cases in New Haven.

item.title: Donald Trump says he will return to Cape Canaveral on Saturday for rocket launch
item.description: President Trump and first lady Melania Trump did not get the chance to watch NASA's first launch with SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket and Crew Dragon capsule, with a bad weather call made.

item.title: The whirlwind that turned this TV star's life upside down
item.description: Mum-to-be Sarah-Jane Mee, 41, reflects on meeting her now fiance Ben Richardson through their mutual friend Autumn Phillips at an event in London.

item.title: New video shows 'Emiliano Sala signing for Cardiff City' as CAS set to rule on £15m transfer row
item.description: EXCLUSIVE BY IAN HERBERT AND SIMON JONES: A previously unseen video of Sala signing three Cardiff City forms could lend support to Nantes and their demand for a £15m fee.

item.title: Diary of a friendship deepened by despair
item.description: Kerry Fisher who lives in Surrey and Pat Sowa who lives in Harrogate have been friends since 1984. The pair have penned a book detailing the life-threatening illness that both of their sons faced.

item.title: 'Zombie' fires may have reignited in Arctic Circle
item.description: The smouldering piles were detected by satellites monitoring emissions from the region. Higher than average temperatures were seen in Greenland and northern and coastal Siberia in April this year.

item.title: YouTube influencer Myka Stauffer draws backlash for rehoming her autistic four-year-old son
item.description: Myka Stauffer, 32, and her husband James posted a tearful video on Tuesday saying they've decided to 'rehome' their adopted 4-year-old son Huxley.

item.title: Dinner for the devils: Fidel Castro, Idi Amin and Saddam Hussein's favourite meals revealed
item.description: Polish writer Witold Szablowski spent four years tracking down the chefs who cooked for some of the world's most sadistic and feared dictators.

item.title: Woman in her 70s is fighting for her life after horrific double-stabbing in north London
item.description: The man and woman, both in their 70s, suffered stab injuries in a home in Islington, north London with police describing it as a 'domestic incident'. She is in a life-threatening condition.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Two households CAN meet from next week
item.description: Ministers are said to have parked proposals for people to be able to mix freely in social 'bubbles' after expert modelling suggested it could lead to a spike in coronavirus .

item.title: No wonder the betting industry keeps gambling with lives, writes campaigner ADAM BRADFORD
item.description: ADAM BRADFORD: The death of 25-year-old Chris Bruney (pictured), an electrical engineer with a good career and his whole life ahead of him, will seem inexplicable to many people.

item.title: Is it just me or are men milking the lockdown? asks FEMAIL's guest columnist RACHEL JOHNSON
item.description: Rachel Johnson who is spending lockdown with her husband and 26-year-old daughter at their family farm on Exmoor, argues that men are milking the nanny state advice to avoid going out.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK could be 'virtually back to normal' by August
item.description: Former Director of the WHO Cancer Programme Professor Karol Sikora, who has garnered a cult following during the crisis, believes that life will be 'virtually back to normal' by August.

item.title: Scott Disick, 37, and Sofia Richie, 21, split after 3 years
item.description: Scott Disick and Sofia Richie have ended their relationship, according to a new report. They had been together for three years and he recently was in rehab.

item.title: How to beat lockdown loneliness & lethargy
item.description: British feminist pioneer Shirley Conran, 87, who is recovering from brain surgery while self-isolating, shares her no nonsense approach to life in lockdown.

item.title: Abused wife Sally Challen wins court battle to inherit estate of the husband she beat to death
item.description: Sally Challen, a woman who beat her controlling husband, Richard, to death with a hammer in 2010 after decades of emotional abuse can inherit his estate, a judge has ruled.

item.title: Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou's US extradition case will proceed
item.description: A Canadian judge ruled Wednesday the US extradition case against a Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou, 48, can continue to the next stage.

item.title: Especially for you, Kylie's corking rosé
item.description: Australian pop star Kylie Minogue, is launching her own brand of rosé today, neatly coinciding with her 52nd birthday. British drinks expert Helen McGinn gives her verdict on the £9 beverage.

item.title: Black's just got a lot hotter: Summer's most stylish look has gone over to the dark side
item.description: Jess Wood shared her advice for embracing this season's black fashion trend. The British style expert recommends opting for an anthracite hue if you want to ease yourself in.

item.title: RICHARD KAY: Kate, Meghan and the snobbish claims that have sparked palace fury
item.description: RICHARD KAY: Kensington Palace took the highly unusual step of publicly and formally distancing itself from claims in the Tatler article. So what was it that has upset them so much?

item.title: Is this really the elixir of youth?
item.description: Claire Coleman examines the research behind No7 Advanced Retinol 1.5% Complex Night Concentrate as the anti-ageing night serum launches at Boots stores across the UK.

item.title: Seven former Tory ministers join group of MPs urging the PM to rethink travel quarantine plan
item.description: A cross-party group of 40 MPs - including former transport secretary Chris Grayling and six other ex-Tory ministers - have joined a taskforce calling for urgent action to rethink the plan.

item.title: ALEX BRUMMER: Landlords take a brutal beating
item.description: Amid the constant tussle between commercial landlords and retailers it is the property owners who are often portrayed as villains. Traditional bugbears play their part in this.

item.title: How to pay for the pandemic? Stark decisions faced by the Chancellor
item.description: The scale of Britain's borrowing and debt binge caused by the lockdown has never been greater. That number should start to ease down as people return to work and the nation's shops open.

item.title: Would you let a stranger hypnotise you over Zoom?
item.description: Flic Everett has been struggling to sleep throughout lockdown. She gives her verdict on curing insomnia using a Zoom session with London-based hypnotherapist Abbey Robb.

item.title: MPs' fury as betting giant dodges £3.5million fine for death of addict
item.description: Chris Bruney, from Sheffield, took his own life hours after being plied with £400 of bonuses by staff at online casino Winner.co.uk, owned by Playtech.

item.title: Phantom of the Opera's 14 month UK and Ireland tour axed amid fears shows won't restart until 2021
item.description: Theatre producer Sir Cameron Mackintosh revealed Phantom of the Opera cancelled all future dates. The first and only performance took place at the Curve Theatre, Leicester, in March.

item.title: Mass extinction 360m years ago caused by ozone layer erosion
item.description: Scientists from the University of Southampton found evidence that it was high levels of ultraviolet radiation that destroyed the ancient forest ecosystem.

item.title: Nurses are sending videos of newborns to parents after visiting hours were slashed due to COVID-19
item.description: Despite the increased pressures, nurses have taken on a wonderful new duty on the maternity ward. Staff at a hospital, in Surrey, have been making videos of newborn babies to send to their parents.

item.title: Reservoir levels fall and our parks turn brown in driest May since Victorian time
item.description: The driest May in 124 years has only seen 1.25in (31.8mm) of rain fall on average across the UK this month, and forecasters say this is unlikely to increase in the final few days of May.

item.title: Phillip Schofield receives Ofcom complaints after saying Donald Trump is 'still there sadly'
item.description: In the show aired last week, the presenter, 58, left viewers shocked over his comment about the US President, 73, during a segment about him taking unproven drug hydroxychloroquine.

item.title: Pygmy sperm whale found on California beach with bullet hole
item.description: Lifeguard Todd Shanklin was on duty at the San Onofre State Beach (pictured) when he made the discovery of the whale on May 15.

item.title: John Boyega reacts on Twitter to George Floyd's tragic death
item.description: Star Wars actor John Boyega has taken to his various social media platforms to express his thoughts about the troubling death of George Floyd.

item.title: New Jeffrey Epstein book 'explains' Clinton-Lewinsky scandal
item.description: The book, ' A Convenient Death: The Mysterious Demise of Jeffrey Epstein' by journalists Alana Goodman and Daniel Halper is out June 2.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Test centres empty as tracing regime announced
item.description: Regional testing sites at Glasgow and Manchester Airports and in Weston-super-Mare stood empty today as the Government revealed its test and trace scheme would start from tomorrow.

item.title: Abigail Disney says Bezos is Darth Vader, Elon Musk is a narcissist and Peter Thiel is a menace
item.description: Answering who the 3 most 'toxic billionaires' were, Abigail Disnet named Jeff Bezos, Elon Musk and Peter Thiel. She said Bezos was like Vader.

item.title: North Korea's founder Kim Il Sung could not teleport, state media admits
item.description: The late Kim ruled from 1948 to 1994 and is still revered as North Korea's 'eternal president' but 'shrinking the earth' to travel in an instant was not among his skills, an article said.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Contact tracing scheme launches TOMORROW
item.description: The UK's coronavirus contact tracing programme will finally launch tomorrow as Health Secretary Matt Hancock admitted it will rely on people doing their 'civic duty' to succeed.

item.title: Coronavirus: 40% Weston-super-Mare hospital staff test positive
item.description: A memo leaked to a local newspaper revealed Weston General Hospital, which has around 2,000 staff, warned of a high rate of coronavirus cases among medics.

item.title: Amazing images show an eight-year-old rescue dog surfing in California
item.description: Sugar, an eight-year-old rescue dog lives near Huntington Beach, California, with her owner, athlete and recovering drug addict Ryan Rustan, 39.

item.title: Ex jockey and TalkTalk CEO during £80m cyber attack who will lead UK's test and trace scheme
item.description: Baroness Dido Harding, 53, was raised on a Somerset pig farm and will lead the UK's test and trace scheme to tackle the coronavirus, set to launch tomorrow.

item.title: Janet Street-Porter and Saira Khan clash on Dominic Cummings
item.description: The broadcaster, 73, claimed the Prime Minister's chief adviser may have been forced to take the trip by his wife Mary, after he defended his actions and refused to resign.

item.title: Father's Day gifts for under £20
item.description: You can get some great gifts for Father's Day this year and still have change from £20. From portable speakers to cologne, we have found eight great gifts for Father's Day on a budget.

item.title: Mary-Kate Olsen's ex moved ex-wife into Hamptons home
item.description: During his breakup from his his wife Mary-Kate Olsen this April, Olivier Sarkozy allegedly moved his ex-wife Charlotte Bernard and their children into their home in the Hamptons.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Confusion as firms asked to STOP home tests
item.description: Britain's Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) has 'asked' companies to stop providing at-home antibody tests after spotting them online.

item.title: RNLI calls for beaches without lifeguards to be shut after three sea deaths
item.description: West Wittering beach (pictured) in West Sussex partially opened today. Today RNLI bosses called on the government to keep beaches without a lifeguard closed following three deaths in Britain.

item.title: Boris Johnson urges MPs to move on from Dominic Cummings row
item.description: The PM urged people to move on from the controversy, saying there had been plenty of 'autobiography' from his chief aide.

item.title: Man born with a deformed face demonstrates impressive singing voice that helped him overcome bullies
item.description: Jilam Samson, 39, from Zamboanga Sibugay, the Philippines, was born with a congenital deformity, giving him a twisted nose, mouth and eyes. He says singing has helped him 'feel special' and confident.

item.title: Paragliders collide in mid-air and plunge into trees 4,000ft below
item.description: Sebastien Watier, 31, found himself hurtling towards the ground from the height of 4757ft with a tangled parachute after hitting a female paraglider above Aiguebelette Lake, Savoie, France.

item.title: Colombian transgender model shares sweet snap of her kissing her HUSBAND'S eight-month baby bump
item.description: Colombian model Danna Sultana, who was born male and identifies as female, is expecting a baby with her husband Esteban Landrau, who was born a woman but identifies as a man.

item.title: Friends claim Meghan and Harry WILL pay for their own security
item.description: A friend of the couple has now claimed that the Sussexes will pay for any security measures out of their own pocket.

item.title: Twitter users stretch words such 'duuuuude' to modify their meaning
item.description: Twitter users stretch words such as 'yes', 'dude' and 'hey' to modify their meaning, according to researchers who analysed 100 billion tweets.

item.title: John Lewis reveals Kingston and Poole are first two stores to reopen on June 15
item.description: The branches selected to reopen, Kingston-upon-Thames in southwest London and Poole in Dorset, have been chosen 'primarily because of their accessibility by car', the retailer said.

item.title: Five-month-old baby dies after drinking turtle blood as COVID-19 remedy in the Dominican Republic
item.description: The five-month-old girl from the Dominican Republic died after drinking turtle blood to protect her from coronavirus. Her relatives are said to be 'serious but stable.'

item.title: Cousins of T. Rex may have resorted to CANNIBALISM when food was scarce
item.description: Experts analysed 2,368 bone fragments unearthed from the Mygatt-Moore Quarry in Colorado, a site which has produced numerous dinosaur specimens.

item.title: Vaping for just a few months puts young, healthy people at risk of oral health problems
item.description: A study from Ohio State University found vaping for only a short period of time, just a handful of months, can lead to significant health problems such as gum disease and oral cancer.

item.title: Prince Andrew made joke with Epstein's sex slave Virginia Roberts after grinding with her topless
item.description: An astonishing new documentary into the life and crimes of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein has brought to light new allegations on Prince Andrew from Virginia Roberts.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll hits 37,460 with 412 new fatalities
item.description: Department of Health figures show the daily number of fatalities is 13.5 per cent higher than the figure announced last Wednesday (363) - and is three times higher than yesterday's (134).

item.title: Ex-New York city subway boss dubbed 'Train Daddy' is appointed as TfL's new transport commissioner
item.description: Andy Byford's (pictured) appointment was confirmed by the capital's mayor Sadiq Khan and the board of Transport for London (TfL) and he will start on June 29.

item.title: Photos of HS2 railway line's 2000-tonne tunnel boring machines
item.description: The machines - which are presently being assembled in Germany - will commence tunnelling for the UK's high-speed rail project later this year.

item.title: Greggs will reopen around 800 stores from mid-June
item.description: Greggs has reopened its first stores in Newcastle as the company prepares to implement new social distancing rules in 800 locations over the next month.

item.title: Father-to-be, 23, jumped to his death from rooftop car park
item.description: Oliver Dinsdale was found at the bottom of a fourth floor car park in Woking. The inquest heard he'd been acting oddly in the weeks leading to his death.

item.title: Stylists at more than 11,000 salons and barbers demand the government allow them to reopen
item.description: Keith Conniford, CEO of the Hair and Barber Council, has estimated that the majority of the 11,000 salons it represents would be ready to open in mid-June.

item.title: People reveal their partners' VERY gross hygiene habits
item.description: People from across the globe have taken to confession-sharing app Whisper to reveal their partners' worst habits - including re-using floss and leaving ear wax to build up.

item.title: Number of jobs furloughed hits 8.4MILLION with another 2.3million self-employed
item.description: Standing by Tory tax and pensions pledges today, Boris Johnson told senior MPs: 'We are going to meet all of our manifesto commitments.'

item.title: Spain proposes allowing travel between coronavirus 'green zones' in Europe
item.description: Spain wants to create a 'green zone travel network' between European regions where coronavirus is low, rather than opening national borders in the hope it will allow tourism to restart quicker.

item.title: Nurse slammed for yelling at carer for wearing her scrubs in a shop is backed by nursing body
item.description: Senior ICU nurse Marina Kendrick, 53, reprimanded Kimberley Simpson in a B&M Bargain store in Burton on Trent for wearing her scrubs in public, an action she said risked spreading 'germs'.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein hid cameras in properties to blackmail friends
item.description: Jeffrey Epstein's surveillance cameras were a 'blackmail scheme' to extort his powerful friends, new Netflix documentary Jeffrey Epstein: Filthy Rich claims.

item.title: Lego-obsessed father spends five years and $96,000 building a huge city with 1,600 Lego sets
item.description: Josh Foote, 35, from New Jersey, United States, began his project back in 2015 and moved it from his bedroom to his new home with a basement as he continued to expand his Lego city.

item.title: Muslim father 'burns his daughter after she converted from Islam to Christianity in Uganda'
item.description: Rahema Kyomuhendo will spend at least a month at Mbale Regional Referral Hospital amid claims her father Sheikh Hussein Byaruhanga Husain badly burned her. Pictured, her injuries.

item.title: Trump threatens to 'regulate' social media after Twitter labels two of his tweets misleading
item.description: Donald Trump demanded social media platforms 'clean up your act' as he warned his administration will begin to regulate such websites after Twitter, for the first time ever, fact-checked his tweets.

item.title: Boy, 6, with 'six-pack' wins place at Liverpool FC Academy
item.description: Arat Hosseini, six (pictured) has wowed his four million Instagram followers with his impressive physique, football and gymnastics skills. Originally from Iran, Arat now lives in Liverpool.

item.title: Girl, 11, plunges 200ft and breaks her back after falling through a gap on a glass walkway
item.description: The 11-year-old dropped to the ground after her safety harness 'fell off', Chinese authorities said. The walkway comprises of dozens of see-through panes with gaps in between.

item.title: New Zealand has NO coronavirus patients in hospital
item.description: The last remaining hospital patient was released last night in Auckland in the latest mark of success for New Zealand's widely-praised response to the pandemic.

item.title: Man dies falling from jet ski in week's third UK seaside fatality
item.description: Emergency services were called out to the seaside town of Teignmouth, Devon, on Tuesday following a 999 call reporting a man in the water after falling off a jet ski.

item.title: Head of Twitter's fact checking has a history of anti-Trump tweets
item.description: Prior tweets from Yoel Roth, whose official title at Twitter is head of Site Integrity, emerged after the social media giant put a fact-checking warning on Trump's posts for the first time on Tuesday.

item.title: French and Belgian police arrest 26 suspects in Europe-wide crackdown on human trafficking
item.description: Those detained are suspected of being part of a criminal organisation trafficking Vietnamese nationals through Belgium and France to the UK.
item.media:description: Twenty-six people have been arrested as part of an investigation into human trafficking across Europe prompted by the discovery of 39 bodies in a lorry container in Essex (Aaron Chown/PA)

item.title: JK Rowling shares drawings of The Ickabog for competition
item.description: JK Rowling shared children's illustrations of The Ickabog on Twitter. The writer, from Edinburgh, said the best drawings will be included in the book, which will be published on November 2.

item.title: Valuable axes from German burial site suggest Neolithic societies were not as egalitarian as thought
item.description: The two weapons were found at the Hofheim-Kapellenberg site near Frankfurt 140 years ago, but have only just been connected with the recently-discovered burial mound.

item.title: Gypsies use 1,000 TONNES of rubble and 12 dumper trucks to build illegal camp in just three days
item.description: Around 12 dumper trucks arrived on the land at Blackbrook, Staffordshire, at 3am last Saturday. Travellers built an illegal camp there overnight, despite being denied planning permission.

item.title: Two Russian fighter jets 'buzz' a US reconnaissance plane over the Mediterranean
item.description: The Su-35 fighters surrounded a P-8A US plane as it flew over the Mediterranean Sea on Tuesday, the US Navy revealed in a statement.

item.title: 28 tonnes of Nazi gold could be hidden under a palace in Poland
item.description: A diary written by an SS officer charged with hiding Nazi treasure from the Red Army as the Second World War drew to a close has revealed one stash is hidden under a palace in Poland, researchers claim.

item.title: Bird-watcher 'unsure how he feels' about firing of white investment banker dubbed Central Park Karen
item.description: Christian Cooper said Tuesday about his encounter with Amy in New York: 'Where she went was a racist place. That action was racist. Does that make her a racist? I can't answer that.'

item.title: Diane von Furstenberg's UK business goes into administration
item.description: Belgian fashion designer Diane von Furstenberg, 73, known for her body-hugging jersey wrap dress, revealed the news in a letter sent to loyal customers yesterday.

item.title: Woman reveals how her husband is made to feel guilty by his siblings after winning on a scratch card
item.description: Posting anonymously on the British parenting site Mumsnet , the woman explained the dispute over the scratchcard had caused a rift within the family.

item.title: Mother, 27, proposed to her former boss, 72, at a strip club during an exotic performance
item.description: Photographer Rachael Chenault, 27, from Belle Vernon, Pennsylvania, was at the club with her now fiancé John Penzera, 72, in May 2018. She asked him to marry her during a performance.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Government mothballs another FOUR NHS Nightingales
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The flagship Nightingale location in London was already mothballed earlier this month, while sites in Birmingham, Bristol, Harrogate and Tyne and Wear are also closed.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Primary school classroom segregates pupils
item.description: Kingsholm Primary School in Gloucester and St Anne's in Sale are among the schools that have revealed how classrooms will look once their pupils return on June 1.

item.title: South Korean cafe hires robot barista to help with social distancing
item.description: A cafe in the South Korean city of Daejeon has installed a coffee-making robot that speaks to customers to help it comply with social distancing measures.

item.title: Moment pervert, 35, is caught after sending sex messages to '12-year-old girl'
item.description: Gary Horn, 35, of Stanley, Country Durham, thought he was chatting to a child online but he was talking to a group of paedophile hunters.

item.title: 'Bullied' civil servant wins £250,000 payout
item.description: Anne Giwa-Amu, an administrative officer at the Department for Work and Pensions, won her race discrimination case after a tribunal found she suffered 'deliberate and humiliating harassment'.

item.title: BBC backs reporter Laura Kuenssberg over Dominic Cummings tweet
item.description: Laura Kuenssberg had responded directly to Daily Mirror political editor Pippa Crerar who first revealed Dominic Cummings's 260-mile journey from London to County Durham with his family.

item.title: Glass-bottom observation deck jutting out from China's 'horizontal skyscraper' will open this week
item.description: The vertigo-inducing platform is part of an impressive corridor which spans across the top of four towers and is billed as a 'horizontal skyscraper'. It will welcome visitors on Saturday.

item.title: Who Wants to be a Millionaire contestant drops from the £500,000 question to £125,000
item.description: Last night a Who Wants to be a Millionaire contestant had viewers on the edges of their seat as she gambled on the £500,000 question despite still having a lifeline left - losing £125,000.

item.title: Man, 29, is arrested for murder of 16-year-old Louise Smith whose body was found in woodland
item.description: The teenager, from the Leigh Park area, was reported missing on VE Day earlier this month, with her body discovered in Havant Thicket,

item.title: UK dismisses Michel Barnier's offer of two-year extension to Brexit transition
item.description: Michel Barnier has repeated that the bloc is 'open' to prolonging the standstill period, as governments focus on the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: A great time to be on holiday? Europe's tourist hotspots are still free from crowds
item.description: St Peter's Square in the Vatican - often heaving with worshippers - has been nearly empty except for a handful of visitors and nuns even after the basilica re-opened its doors.

item.title: One in three women in Europe has inherited a Neanderthal fertility gene
item.description: The study published by researchers at the Max Planck Institute found one in three women inherited their receptor for progesterone from our ancient cousins.

item.title: Saudi Sheikh is locked in a feud with exclusive Mayfair casino over '£2 million gambling debt'
item.description: Sheikh Salah Hamdan Al Balawi is accused of failing to settle debt with the Les Ambassadeurs Club, London. The High Court heard there was little chance the casino wouldn't retrieve sums.

item.title: Missing dog rescued after being trapped in root 'tomb'
item.description: Terrier cross Teazle, eight, became entangled under the tree roots after running off to play during an afternoon walk in the woods at Milton Abbas, Dorset, with her owner Clare Tredrea on May 7.

item.title: Cliff-top mansion on Channel Island of Jersey goes on sale for £18m
item.description: A stunning California-style cliff-top mansion complete with an infinity pool and wine cave has gone on sale for £18million on the Channel Island of Jersey.

item.title: Girl, 13, beheaded by her father while she slept in Iranian honour killing
item.description: Romina Ashrafi, aged 13, was killed with a sickle in her family home in Hovigh, Talesh county, Iran, as a form of 'punishment', local media have reported.

item.title: Chernobyl Diaries actor Dimitri Diatchenko died of 'fentanyl and valium overdose'
item.description: Diatchenko's body was discovered at his property in Daytona Beach on April 22 after police were asked to conduct a wellness check on the star, who had not been seen for several days.

item.title: D-day for schools: Final decision on whether classes will return on June 1 will be made TOMORROW
item.description: The Schools Standards Minister said plans for reception and years one and six to go back on June 1 would depend on evidence that the R rate was continuing to drop across the UK.

item.title: Mother of woman stabbed to death by ex-boyfriend in Spain reveals her outrage ahead of release
item.description: Alan Daulby, 35, was convicted of stabbing 20-year-old Avril Flanagan (pictured) to death more than 50 times with a kitchen knife at his Costa Blanca flat in 2009.

item.title: Boy, 12, 'is lured away by Ukrainian paedophile who murdered him and had sex with corpse
item.description: WARNING DISTRESSING CONTENT: The schoolboy, Rodion Volkov, was returning home from football training when a man approached him in the city of Dnipro, in the central part of the country.

item.title: Fisherman jailed for pinching easyJet steward's bottom
item.description: Gavin Capps, 51, was jailed for six months at Minshull Street Crown Court in Manchester after his conviction for assaulting a male cabin crew member on an easyJet flight.

item.title: Thai monarch and some of 20-strong female entourage spotted cycling near German hotel
item.description: The King of Thailand swapped his royal attire for cycling gear as he took his harem out for a bike ride near a luxury German hotel - where he has converted an entire floor into a 'pleasure palace'.

item.title: Ex-Labour spin doctor Alastair Campbell breaks social distancing rules for speedo man selfie
item.description: Mr Campbell posted a picture on Twitter of himself with Speedo Mick early this morning after taking a dip in the Serpentine lake in Hyde Park.

item.title: Horrifying moment a swarm of locusts engulfs the streets of India
item.description: Locals ran for shelter as 'billions and trillions' of locusts invaded a residential area of Jaipur, engulfing a staircase and blanketing the sky as they soared over rooftops.

item.title: Chinese state newspaper warns 'narcissistic' and 'bullying' Britain to stay out of Hong Kong affairs
item.description: Beijing's Global Times condemned Britain before the Chinese rubber-stamp parliament is due to pass a national security law bill that would significantly reduce the freedoms of Hong Kong citizens.

item.title: Pictured: Scarborough girl, 14, who died from a 'ecstasy overdose' at lockdown house party
item.description: Jessica Hannah (pictured), 14, passed away after a lockdown party with friends in Scarborough, North Yorkshire, on May 20.

item.title: Lance Armstrong's former team-mate Tyler Hamilton insists he is still keeping secrets
item.description: Hamilton himself is a serial doping cheat, his final eight-year ban effectively ending his own career, and he insists that Armstrong is only telling 'half-truths' in his new two-part ESPN documentary LANCE.

item.title: Vicar, 66, quits after his affair with married woman was exposed
item.description: Reverend John Girtchen, 66, agreed to a penalty of resignation and a four-year prohibition as a priest from May 31. He was in charge at All Saints church in Goxhill, Lincolnshire, for nearly 20 years.

item.title: Tracey Cox talks to three women who found threesomes a changing experience
item.description: British sex expert Tracey Cox spoke to three women who had life changing experiences when they had a threesome and shared tips on how to survive group sex as a couple.

item.title: Hippo throws impala over its head in South African river after battling hyenas and wild dogs
item.description: The rare riverside battle of four species was filmed in Kruger National Park. Photographer Rogan Kerr and field guide Francois Pienaar took videos of the hippo fighting African wild dogs and killing an impala.

item.title: Tricky geography quiz will put your knowledge to the test - so can YOU achieve a perfect score?
item.description: The challenging quiz was created by Michael Rogers for trivia site Playbuzz. It is compiled of 16 questions to 'prove you truly are a geek' by testing your knowledge of geography.

item.title: BMW increases the BMW 5 series price and the size of its grille
item.description: As an example of the price rises for the 5-series, BMW said the new incoming 520i SE now starts from £37,970 on-the-road compared to £37,600 for the outgoing model - a jump of £370.

item.title: Princess Beatrice reveals she faced 'doubt' that she was 'good enough' at school
item.description: Princess Beatrice, 31, who is currently isolating in Chipping Norton, has revealed how 'her struggles with dyslexia at school have been 'life-defining' in a new video for Made By Dyslexia.

item.title: Tiger cub 'seeks out human help' and approaches houses after losing her mother in Siberia
item.description: A wild tiger cub took the unusual step of seeking human help after losing her mother in east Siberia. She came close to houses in Gornovodnoye and was spotted padding down the road.

item.title: Model, 19, admits she feels 'guilty' after bonding with a rough sleeper on Rich Kids Go Homeless
item.description: Instagram model Kaya, 19, of London, who describes spending her father's money as a 'hobby' swaps her life of luxury for sleeping rough in tonight's episode of Rich Kids Go Homeless.

item.title: Rise and fall of the Army's incredible off-road trackless land trains
item.description: In the 1950s, the Army commissioned a series of increasingly advanced over-land trains that could haul equipment though the wilderness to build remote early-warning radar stations.
